website_summaries.verdict: Despite a few quirks that could be frustrating, this model is worth considering if you need a label maker that works fast and falls on the middle of the price scale.
pros: Prints quickly considering the mid-range price - as many as 71 labels per minute
No ink replacement necessary, thanks to the thermal printing capability
cons: Print sometimes turns out crooked on labels

website_summaries.verdict: The Dymo LabelWriter 450 Turbo delivers fast speed for printing on a variety of labels, including postage labels by way of the Endicia Web site.
pros: Comes with excellent label-printing program plus driver and add-ins for Word and Excel
cons: Word add-in doesn't integrate smoothly with Word

customer_reviews.title: Simple and easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: After reading some negative reviews on the dymo 450 turbo I was hesitant but I ordered one anyway, I must say it worked perfect with zero issues and prints very fast, perfect for what I need
customer_reviews.author: GDavidson

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love this machine. As a LuLaRoe Consultant I ship constantly and was going to the post office every day at first. This thing saves me so much time and was crazy easy to set up. Literally just plugged it in and downloaded the desktop application.
customer_reviews.author: Ariel B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for eBay shipping labels
customer_reviews.text: Well packaged did look like it was opened but everything thing inside looked like Brand New, (sealed up with protective plastic film all attached) Super easy install and works perfectly for eBay shipping labels. Needed this to replace a 7 year old one that died. You will want to use 99019 Compatible 2-5/16" x 7-1/2" labels and choose 99019 Large Lever Arch (3rd from the bottom on your drop down paper size list) Using printer on a Windows 10 Laptop. Oh and you do not "Need" to use Dymo Brand Labels!!! They are way over priced. I have used Office Smart Labels and these  Not 1 bad print or paper jam with either of these!!
customer_reviews.author: Edward Y

customer_reviews.title: Amazon FBA must-have!
customer_reviews.text: I recently started with Amazon FBA and after doing extensive research on laser and thermal printers for my barcodes I decided on the DYMO 450 turbo. So far I haven't regretted my decision for a single second. The setup was fast and simple, took me 10 minutes tops. The barcodes come out perfect and I like that fact that it's small and doesn't take up much space on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: NSquale

customer_reviews.title: it is great now. even if it breaks again after a ...
customer_reviews.text: I originally ordered directly from DYMO for $135, but it broke after 1 year. I found this on Amazon for half price, it is great now. even if it breaks again after a year I will not be as upset as I got the first one because I paid half price. it is a good machine , I use a lot.
customer_reviews.author: BB

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I have ever used!
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk! Only ordered it because it was one of the few printers compatible with our new POS platform. Labels rarely stay aligned- they don’t scan half the time because they won’t stay centered- the actual Dymo labels we use with this printer are flimsy and difficult to work with- this was a total waste of $ and is a constant exercise in frustration in our busy store.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Garrison

customer_reviews.title: Great Label Printer
customer_reviews.text: I just installed this and am very pleased with it. I use it just for the convenience of printing personal address labels. Software & printer installed flawlessly on Win 10 and was connected to 4 port USB 2.0 hub-no problems. Software program is fairly easy to use; still playing with it, but should be a snap to master. Because I didn’t RTFM properly I jammed the labels on initial install; couldn’t clear the jam so I had to take unit apart. I fixed it, but was ready to buy a new one :-). Entirely my fault. Again, a great unit at a nice price and hope it continues to function as it should.
customer_reviews.author: JQ

customer_reviews.title: JAMS FREQUENTLY, WASTING LABELS AND TIME! s
customer_reviews.text: So I currently own 1x LabelWriter 4XL 2x LabelWriter 450 Twin Turbo 1x LabelWriter 450 which all work great Decided to add the LabelWriter 450 Turbo to the collection, what a big mistake, which I regret every time I use it. It jams very frequently, sometimes every other label. Every time this happens, I lose two labels, and waste time. I can rewind the label and reload it, but then I get 4 lines on the label that jammed. I am very disappointed with this item. I have uploaded video of this happening in my review.
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Worst Software Interface EVER
customer_reviews.text: I have a LabelWrier 450 Turbo at work and it is a dream to use. However, when I bought one for home use it came with DMYO Connect with is the worst piece of junk software I've used since the 1990's. Poor layout, no useful user guide, mystery buttons which do NOTHING and the intuitive ones don't do what you want them to do. Horrible thing to use. After hours of trying I can print labels, but every one is a pain to set up. I'd never buy one of these again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Hanney

customer_reviews.title: If you have a Mac, DO NOT BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Mac computer and are buying this to print labels on ebay DON'T DO IT. Seriously. I read hours and hours of reviews and thought it was going to be awesome. Problem is, it is impossible to print an accurately sized label on ebay using this label maker if you have a Mac. I have tried four different browsers, all of the recommendations I could find, and the post office won't accept my postage as valid. This machine has cost me hours of work trying to get it to work, and it just doesn't. Save yourself from the frustration!
customer_reviews.author: Corwin Decker

customer_reviews.title: Good Label printer if your software supports it but if ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Label printer if your software supports it but if you want to use the software that comes with the product don't count on it doing what you would think and if you call support and ask for what else supports the printer they have no idea, I'm just trying to print a barcode and the software that is comes with is lacking and they can't tell you who's software will work with the printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful product to have around the office
customer_reviews.text: We would up getting a lot of use out of this as soon as it came out of the box. We printed over 300 stickers as we hit the floor running the first day and have been using it ever since. It is lightyears better when it comes to performance than their smaller USB model (DYMO LabelManager Plug N Play) since it doesn't error out half the time (the smaller model is notorious for printing about 50-60% of a label and stopping for no reason, leading to a massive waste in labels). We haven't (knock on wood) had a single label misprint yet, and we are on our 5th or 6th roll by now.
customer_reviews.author: Poc Network // Tech

customer_reviews.title: A complete waste of money
customer_reviews.text: A complete waste of money! In additional to jamming when I didn't use proprietary Dymo labels, this printer would not function with two software programs that required the use of thermal printer. I immediately returned this to Amazon. Lesson learned! I'll stick to my Zebra LP 2844 which works right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great labeler- horrible horrible software
customer_reviews.text: Pain in the butt to install - just wish there was better software. I had to go back to older versions for it to work, even with running windows 10 with the latest updates. Ultimately after hours and hours of trial and error, installs and reinstalls, it works and works great. Love the postage feature, just hoping the software doesn’t crash on me again!
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Great label maker
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this label maker. I use it for so many different things and projects along with printing shipping labels. I do wish I had the bigger one so I could print UPS labels but the price difference at the time of purchase was drastic. Something along the lines of $100. This one has gotten plenty of use though. I have made address labels and even label things around the house like storage tubs. Much better than paying for ink using a household printer. I definitely would buy this again and may even eventually buy the bigger one.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron R.

customer_reviews.title: Only works with their labels and customer service was not pleasant
customer_reviews.text: Dymo intentionally makes their printer compatible with only their overpriced print stock. Just like the ink jet printer model. If you are happy paying for their labels then this is probably a good choice, but I am tired of this low priced bait and long term bleed sales structure. My brand new printer went into the trash after talking with their customer service and finding out about the compatibility issues with other print stock. Should have paid a little more for another printer to save a lot of money.
customer_reviews.author: Bill N

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought
customer_reviews.text: I needed to buy a printer to print name labels for my group of kids check in and out. This was SUPER easy to set up and worked like a charm!! I expected some learning curve to be involved but everything was pretty straightforward. I'm not the most techy person, tend to skim through directions, and this was as easy as 1,2,3. Not too expensive and the refills for the labels are reasonably priced. The ONLY downside.. is that you have two wires coming out and it is not the prettiest thing to look at and easiest to store with two ugly cords.. but ehh can't have everything.
customer_reviews.author: JLO

customer_reviews.title: Great small label printer
customer_reviews.text: Easier to work with than the twin turbo, and 1/3 the width. Same carrier for the labels up top. Recommend having a pick nearby in case a label gets stuck in the feed... took me a few tries to get them out quickly.. Then, recommend sending either slightly folded paper or cardstock to clear any remaining pieces... They do sell cleaning cards, recommended.. We push our equipment to the limits, including operating in rainy environments. This did impressively well considering the challenges. (Tested in Florida) Power supply is 24V DC, and has the same power supply as the twin version.
customer_reviews.author: aj4mq

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool For Foreign Language Students!
customer_reviews.text: I use this with the 2-up file folder labels (30277) to label things around the house with the Russian word and its English equivalent. This is powerfully helpful to me in my Russian class at college.
customer_reviews.author: Dancemena

customer_reviews.title: Tens of thousands of labels and still going strong!
customer_reviews.text: We use 3 different Dymo printers every day with our 4XL having tens of thousands of labels worth of printing on it so far. Overall these printers last awhile, are pretty quick at printing, and they simply get the job done. I would recommend the 450 turbo over the standard 450 as the speed difference is quite significant.
customer_reviews.author: Jonah Mack

customer_reviews.title: Works excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Good seller. I was having difficulties with the product but seller was responsive and helpful in regards to helping me set up labelprinter and print with PayPal. Appreciate it very much. Labelwriter is Very useful for a small online business whether it’s etsy, PayPal, Amazon, private business, etc
customer_reviews.author: Trang Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: DYMO label workhorse
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my older model of this device with this new one due to a firmware update that made the old one obsolete. (Customer service tried but were unable to get my old one working.) The new one works as well as the old one used to work. I seem to print lots of labels -- addresses, especially at the holidays, and file folder labels, mostly. Its add-ins with MS-Outlook, Word and Excel make it very easy to print large numbers of labels. Even though people miss getting a hand-addressed envelope with a greeting card inside, the printed labels with bar-codes always speed my mail to their correct destination, so to me that's more important.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Ch.

customer_reviews.title: Speedy little thing
customer_reviews.text: Ease of use: 5 stars Labels: 5 stars Quality of Print: 4 stars Speed: 5 stars No ink: 1E6 stars!! Great little printer. I find myself mailing things instead of doing it online just so I can print the label! I wish I had bought the Duo just so I could have endless return addresses. I removed one star because the quality of the print is just average.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy McFadden

customer_reviews.title: Fools Gold this product may have been made in China ?
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK Going on Net to down Load, Good Luck for those of us that are handicap, I went to Dymo.com to download, Prehaps at 79 i am too stupid to read the many (how Too) now after many tries I must wait until Sunday when I am to receive the labels. what was sent with the lablemaker did not .well not work, So stupid I am purchased a Brother Label maker QL 500 They give you the software on a DVD, my Mac did not work with the lable maker now I must get a note to come and make it work The cost 250.00 THINK
customer_reviews.author: Michael Bellas

customer_reviews.title: Software nightmare
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the labels it turns out are OK but the software interface with the printer stinks. Printing arrangements limited and often won't come up when clicked on. No easy way to center the address or label print. Consequently, every label requires trial and error to get the alignment right. Also, set a print size and the software changes it for no apparent reason. All in all am sorry I went with this as opposed to replacing my old Seiko with a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: By far the worst label printing software I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: By far the worst label printing software I have ever used. Cumbersome, full of bugs, and deplorable UI. At times, I have to remake labels from a blank template because there is no way to manipulate objects in the background. Eventually, images you have inserted into labels somehow become progressively destructed. Even simple manipulations such as the copy and paste of a text object from one label to another is not possible. The people responsible for this horrific software deserve to be fired.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Terrible, non-functional software for Mac
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product; poorly designed; limited instructions that are not correct. The produce will not work if set up exactly, precisely as stated in the instructions. The software, while appearing to be nice and fully functional, simple does not work at all on a Mac running Catalina (the current shipping version of MacOS). Can enter content for address labels, but can't actually get them to print (won't let you chose a different saved address label to print. I'll never by another DYMO product and I encourage you not to waste your time with this garbage product.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Desert Gator

customer_reviews.title: it works great. But
customer_reviews.text: When it works, it works great. But, when I doesn't work....its a disaster. I don't believe the machine recognizes the labels when I change out labels (and yes, I am using labels that came with the machine). Many labels are wasted trying to get it to feed and work. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: WhittySmitty

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of time.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to print postage only to find you cannot. At least directly. YOU PAY ADDITIONALY MONTHLY FOR A SERVICE TO PRINT EACH POSTAGE YOUR ALSO PAYING FOR. Labels included are no longer supported either. Its Netstamps instead of Endicia. So, guess what your paying again. Support tells me there is no other way. Just wanted to save time printing some stamps on occasion. What a joke.
customer_reviews.author: Shadow Moses

customer_reviews.title: Slow but simple
customer_reviews.text: Don't like that the software keeps opening up every time I use it. Don't like how freaking slow it is printing my barcode labels. But...it works okay, I'll set the printer to print 300 labels, and walk away for awhile. It's the only choice my software gives me for the time being, but I'm getting a new printer when something faster (and compatible) comes out. Labels are needlessly expensive.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Hard to believe its a new product
customer_reviews.text: Cant believe I bought a new product! I am half inclined to return it. This box was opened, the bubble back replaced on the printer, the UBS cable missing. To register the product with DYMO takes ten tries, I wonder how the support will be. I bought the printer and labels as a package, I am literally scratching my head. In fact, there was even a label stuck to the printer when I first opened it. I need it during the holidays for my shipping (which is why I am stuck with it).
customer_reviews.author: DevB

customer_reviews.title: Like It
customer_reviews.text: I like this label maker so far. It is fast and makes nice labels and has a lot of options. I do not like the size - it is bigger than it looks in the pictures, and I almost returned it, but decided to keep and I'm glad I did. I also think its a bit pricey. But, I use it all the time. I have not used the stamp option yet. I would recommend to anyone looking for a label maker. As for the controversy around having to buy their labels, well that is the case with many products like printers, etc., so it does not bother me, but I'm not using it as a business.
customer_reviews.author: V. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Very user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Wife wanted a label maker for her home business. After some searching I found this for her. Good reviews for the price. She likes it very much for her mailings. I used to print out a printed sheet of paper for mailing packages out of town. Wifey suggested I try this and I'm not doing it the old way anymore! Downloading and installing the software is easy and adding names and addresses is simple. I have the software on my puter and she on hers. We keep our address books separate. Simple, easy setup, small footprint.... Stop procrastinating and just buy this. You won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: Wutzup

customer_reviews.title: Maybe this one is defective...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second dymo. The first one has worked flawlessly, however this one has been nothing but trouble from the start. The printer constantly wastes paper, gets jammed, and acts like it's not aligned correctly and 9/10 misprints/does not print the first label. I am have tried all sorts of ways to align this so it would work correctly, but 2 months later and still the same issues...
customer_reviews.author: N.N

customer_reviews.title: A great little machine.
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with my DYMO 450 Turbo Labelwriter. It's a delight to use. I could have used help getting started, like being told there was software available for downloading or the MS Word plugin. But a quick search on YouTube showed me what I needed to know. I really like how quickly I can make a professional label or a funny one. I made quick name tags for a recent event and it was easy to add a nautical flair to the name tags to match the event theme. It's quick and easy to change labels and there are a variety of sizes available for purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce

customer_reviews.title: ... little printer that for labeling does the work really good! However
customer_reviews.text: This is a lovely little printer that for labeling was doing the work really good! However, I just got it last December and lately the labels they are constantly getting stuck to the point that Its just too much! Today the thermal unit stop working and the labels are all coming out blank... So I'm wondering is this nice little printer suppose to only work for a few months? I need a replacement!
customer_reviews.author: Roberto Carboni

customer_reviews.title: Awesome label maker
customer_reviews.text: Awesome label maker. Love that I do not have to buy ink. It took me awhile to figure out how to use it. But I just went to youtube.com and put in the label writer description and it came up with a how to video for what I am doing with my business. It's really easy once you know what to do..
customer_reviews.author: S.Stutts

customer_reviews.title: Learning Curve
customer_reviews.text: The learning curve has been difficult with this item. I called Dymo for customer service help since I couldn't get it to print with Inventory Lab. I was told that they aren't trained to troubleshoot if the printer work well with its own Dymo software. After hours of trying to get it to work, I found that the software that came with it wasn't compatable with Chrome. Once I downloaded the most up-to-date Dymo software, it immediately worked. I would expect that this kind of information would be included with the printer especially if it doesn't include the most up-to-date software. My friend had the same problem the following week, so this isn't a one-incident problem.
customer_reviews.author: poetryandtea

customer_reviews.title: This one's great! Consider Twin Turbo too!
customer_reviews.text: I was resistant to buying a single-purpose printer, but now I don't want to do without it. I use this primarily for printing shipping labels directly from eBay. Now I don't need to change paper in the printer each time I want to print a single label. This saves time and the hassle of changing paper and changing it back again. You'll never buy ink for this printer. The print head is thermal which makes a nice crisp image. These are the labels I use to print directly from eBay: Before you buy, you may want to consider the. I wish I had ordered that one instead, to have shipping labels and another label ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Wastes labels
customer_reviews.text: Every time I use the machine for the first time in a day, it spits out a blank label. It's really annoying since I don't print many. About 30% - 50% of my labels are wasted as they can't be run through again. I've used many older Dymo printers, and they never did this. Very aggravating. The prints are fine, but it's costing me 30-50% more in wasted labels. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: DJD

customer_reviews.title: Great for customization!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for work to make address labels for mailboxes and name tags. This is easy to set up but It requires you to download software (where you actually create and type your label) to your computer and connect the label printer to your computer via USB and also connect the label printer to an outlet. The software program has a slight learning curve; it's similar to Bluebeam got those of you who are familiar with that. This is better than your usual printer and label sheets because it can use custom label sizes up to a certain size. Overall, it makes great custom labels. I recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Stamp printing software is unusable
customer_reviews.text: The software is awful. It looks like the poor excuse for instructions included with the printer is outdated. One instruction directs you to a web site to print postage that does not align with the stamp label, mainly because the serial number they request is not actually on the stamp role included in the box. The other instruction is to download stamp printing software that requires you to sign in with an account that is suspended and will not reset. So far I have wasted a couple of hours trying to get this to work and it is basically useless. I've been in the software industry for 30 years the user experience is beyond unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome. I use it for mailers at work and ...
customer_reviews.text: I had never used a thermal printer before so excuse the ignorance. This thing is awesome. I use it for mailers at work and have yet to experience having to get rid of a half of sheet of labels, ink running out or ink smearing. That's because you don't have to worry about any of that with this printer. If I have to send one letter, it doesn't have to be held up because we are worried about waste.
customer_reviews.author: CHAcosterr

customer_reviews.title: Software failure, jams, non-scannable barcodes.... useless now
customer_reviews.text: Worked great for about a year, then it stopped working correctly out of nowhere. The barcode no longer scans, it's fuzzy instead of crisp and it jams or screams when prompted to print. I can anticipate it every time as it seems to be a function issue now rather than a user error. I have purchased and returned two of these since and they both had issues. Now I have the original one that I basically use to print information with SKU that I end up having to enter in manually so this is only saving me from writing on each retail tag manually. So frustrating and a complete waste.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Great Support.
customer_reviews.text: This was purchased to replace an older LabelWriter 220. Quality is much improved over the previous product. I did have a problem getting it set up on my Windows 10 system, and had to contact Customer Support. It took a few tries to troubleshoot the problem, but Customer Support was really great. First, unlike many customer support reps, who assume the caller is a "dumb user" the Dymo person, treated me with respect. The troubleshooting information was clear and accurate. It works as I expected, and I'm extremely pleased with both the LabelWriter and the Customer Support.
customer_reviews.author: online learning evangelist

customer_reviews.title: easy easy setup and purchasing products
customer_reviews.text: the beautiful print out of postage and labels; it was so easy to use. easy to download software. cost was higher than a few months ago but loved buying such an easy printer/label writer. was worth the money. don't ever have to go out to get stamps again and look for labels to place on anything, packages or envelopes. glad i purchased this. would buy another one for anyone in family if they see how cost saving this is for anyone that uses labels and need postage print out. love it; did i say love it. thanks amazon, you rock
customer_reviews.author: nana

customer_reviews.title: Old one is better
customer_reviews.text: I had the non-turbo one for 6 years, zero issues. This "turbo" one is worse in every way. Annoying sound, it jams, it is "turbo" doggie do-do.
customer_reviews.author: toshi station

customer_reviews.title: Not a fit for me.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to print address labels from MS-Access. The Dymo website says, "Using DYMO Label Software, you can quickly print mailing labels from a number of standard database formats including Microsoft Access..." I expected the Dymo software to hook into MS-Access and print labels as needed. That is not the case. You have to export the data from MS-Access to the Dymo software to print anything. If you have static data that would probably work fine, but if you have an active dynamic database this product isn't for you.
customer_reviews.author: Clint H

customer_reviews.title: Five years on unit one - bought this second one.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. No setup issues. I like the label management software supplied. Of course we all hate the incredible markup on the label stock from DYMO, but there are third part suppliers that work well. Would buy again. I use this in my personal office for time saving and professional appearance of the few things I still mail. I print perhaps 10 labels per month. Beginning to end takes me 17 seconds to print a saved label. This is my second unit. First is working fine after 5 years.
customer_reviews.author: M. Pallaver

customer_reviews.title: Our Dymo 450 is used on a daily basis and ...
customer_reviews.text: Our Dymo 450 is used on a daily basis and is still running strong after more than a year of daily use. We've probably run 10,000+ labels through it and no hiccups. Note that off brand labels, while cheaper, may or may not work with the printer (you will get an "out of paper" error if they don't). Wish Dymo would allow for easier 3rd party label use, though it's understandable they would want you to use their brand name labels.
customer_reviews.author: Abraham

customer_reviews.title: FBA seller must !
customer_reviews.text: A must have for any FBA seller. I will admit loading the first roll of labels was frustrating but after searching for a video online it was very easy once you see it done. Adjusting the print parameters is also tricky but a simple internet search should help get it to print the way you want. I use a different brand of labels and they work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Adam C.

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Nice for printing those envelope labels. Replacement labels are a bit high priced though. The postal labels are a pain to load and sometimes jam up the printer which doesn't allow you to open up fully and get the stuck label out. You have to work at it for a while to get it to release.
customer_reviews.author: Nola

customer_reviews.title: Ours broke in less than a year. Buyer beware!!!
customer_reviews.text: Less than 1 year and less than 500 labels and the printer is trash. It only prints these black lines no matter what the label looks like. Dymo has no customer support and noFAQ about this problem. A google search reveals that the thermal head is bad and I need a new printer....in less than a year!!! Also, the software leaves much to be desired. Most labels have to be printed one at a time, no excel spreadsheets.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya Brown

customer_reviews.title: I like this label writer
customer_reviews.text: I like this label writer. Only problem i encounter with this series is when it print out one label, you tear it off from the cutter. It will spit out an empty label. I do not know whether there's a way to make it stop spitting out unprinted label. So I stop tearing off the labels when the power is on.
customer_reviews.author: Bilberry

customer_reviews.title: Not dependable at all
customer_reviews.text: I feel ripped off. Had to replace my first one after almost two years of only using it an average of 156 days out of the year, and minimal printing during those days. It stopped working. Bought a second one, and now this one is unusable after only having it 9 months. The labels, even though I bought Dymo brand labels, would get jammed in the roller, and the design is such that you can't easily remove the roller to get the labels unstuck. Poorly designed, and I am angry that I spent any money on this at all.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, good quality, software maybe a pain sometimes
customer_reviews.text: Installation was a pain, it’s can be hard to manage sometimes but it’s good once you know how to use it. You need to instal a few softwares to use it and would stop working sometimes. Other than that, the printer is very good, fast, good quality etc. I have 3 of them now and they are great.
customer_reviews.author: andre del rio

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy with the Last Two Dymo Printers Purchased
customer_reviews.text: This product has broken and can't obviously be repaired it's not worth what it would cost to repair. The window closed April 15th to return. The person I bought it for just brought it to me yesterday and I had to toss the machine and purchase something else.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey L. Spencer

customer_reviews.title: It jammed but So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good but it jammed in the first day because I played with the buttons a lot and the label got peeled during printing and stick to the cartridge and jammed. I got scared but checked the youtube video how to open it up. I give them a credit to open and close it was fairly easy and I fixed it in 20 min. I am using it about 6 months and so far so good
customer_reviews.author: AMZ Mit

customer_reviews.title: Go thermal forget inkjet printers
customer_reviews.text: Call the 800 dymo customer service phone number included in the package they will remotely install any programs and everything that you need your computer must have Google Chrome for this to be compatible to print eBay shipping labels and most shipping labels but after you go to Thermal you won't want to go back the inkjet is fantastic
customer_reviews.author: heyrob

customer_reviews.title: Fast, efficient, and consistent.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed for labeling glass jars. I wish the software was a little more customizable, but that is really a small complaint. I sell spirits and this is the perfect size for labeling my 2oz sample jars. Everything about the software is set up for address labels. I have a much rarer use case, so I get it.
customer_reviews.author: Teek Lee

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BY DYMO AGAIN .. EVER.. Unless you want to pull your hair out  , then go ahead and buy
customer_reviews.text: Error to install Error to download software Error in shipping containment Errors - Device does not work, software does not download, technical service phones shut down at 5, even if its in the middle of phone call. every step of this process. there are ERRORS AND BUGS
customer_reviews.author: TNC

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this quick and easy label maker
customer_reviews.text: I love this label maker!! First it’s eazy to load the labels, it’s easy to close, the usb connects to the co outer, I installed the label writer application and that’s it.. I pick the size of the label, I write what I need and it prints within a second. It has a tear off cutter as well inside so I don’t have to worry about cutting my hands or just ripping the label off.
customer_reviews.author: Tonya

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this little machine for printing postage
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had bought this when I first started selling on eBay. LOVE this little machine for printing postage. The 99029 labels are accepted by the post office no problem. No need to spend $100 more on the machine that prints the 4 x 6 labels. Awesome product. My only complaint is it doesn't shut down when I shut down the computer and does not have an on/off switch. Otherwise this is the perfect machine for shipping postage for me.
customer_reviews.author: chickenchick

customer_reviews.title: Good overall function
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to print hundreds of wedding labels. Overall the printer works great without any issues. Even color and very quick. However, the software has a ways to go. For example: there is no way to change the font if you import your excel document. You much change the excel document to the address book (several steps) and modify it that way. If better instruction this wouldn't have been so bad, however I spent over 2 hours on the phone with reps before I figured it out on my own. As for function I have zero complaints or frustrations as it has saved me hours of work.
customer_reviews.author: KWF

customer_reviews.title: WARNING - These break and Dymo will not stand behind them!
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased 5 of these over the last 2 years, and have run 10s of thousands of labels, so i feel qualified to speak to how they work. Over time, the feed mechanism starts jamming. Wadding up the labels inside the print head. And then, when you call Dymo during the warranty period, they do NOT stand behind them. Meaning these printers should be considered "disposable" - don't expect them to last if you're using them in a business environment. 6 months is about all I get out of them. Too bad, because otherwise they're a good printer.
customer_reviews.author: Mia Nelson

customer_reviews.title: Might last you 6 months, if you're lucky.
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked fine for about a month. Then it "lost" its drivers. I called tech support who, of course, told me the problem was my computer updating something for windows which had corrupted the drivers and they would need to be re-installed.... well, I re-installed the drivers. It lasted about a week, then I had the same issue. And again a few weeks later. By this time I am past my "return window" and am stuck with a printer that needs to be uninstalled and re-installed every couple weeks. Until, after having it for less than 6 months it will no longer do anything. I RECOMMEND BUYING ANOTHER PRINTER! NOT THIS ONE!
customer_reviews.author: G Buss

customer_reviews.title: SAME speed as LW50 model
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 2 stars because of the misleading information! I own now3 models of DYMO printers- 450, 4XL and purchased this one since it advertised with faster printing speed compare to 450. IT'S A LIE! 450 and 450 Turbo models are exactly the same, same speed but the 450Turbo is more expensive!
customer_reviews.author: Tatiana

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. Had a horrible paper jam that had me ready to return but customer service was excellent. Stayed on the phone with me until I got it. What caused it was the sticky part of the labels when new.. I didn't rip that piece off where the tape was stuck to that holds it together. So can't blame anyone but myself
customer_reviews.author: JazzyNYC

customer_reviews.title: Jams, then stops working
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked fine for a few days, then peeled apart label when printing and it wrapped the label around itself jamming the mechanism. Since then, despite cleaning (with overpriced "cleaning cards"), it now spits out 4 blank labels for every one printed, then goes into error state. COMPLETELY USELESS. Am looking for another label maker. WARNING: don't but this one.
customer_reviews.author: Len Castelli

customer_reviews.title: I've had many Label Printers...
customer_reviews.text: Most of them have been Dymo, these get more than just address label usage tho. As a quilter who keeps her fabrics in plastic bins I use the labels to make the name of the color for the bins, I use them for notions stored in bins, craft items, etc... I've also used them to name the room a box should go in when we've moved. I actually print labels on my bigger printer with address label paper. :)
customer_reviews.author: Seams To Be Sew

customer_reviews.title: Never worked and customer support not much help
customer_reviews.text: Decided to return this product after trying to get help with customer support. After the multitude of pictures, check this, check that, which I had already done prior to contacting tech support they decided to "replace" my device but had more hoops to jump through. When we have been emailing back and forth already about the "claim number" at issue now you want me to print a picture of the unit and write on that picture the claim number after the claim number is already documented in the emails with the attached pictures. No thanks I'll just return everything and get my money back and work with a brand who will actually work.
customer_reviews.author: Julie Clark

customer_reviews.title: Efficient Name Tags and labels
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this for a major event check-in name tag printing and it was incredibly simple and easy to download the software, design our name tags and enter as our attendees checked in. It was far more efficient than printing hundreds of name tags ahead of time and trying to find the correct name tag (which slows down check-in). We could peel and stick them onto the clip name tags, but they were too wide to fit inside the name tag holders. It was exactly what we needed to streamline our event.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Burman

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful label printer!
customer_reviews.text: I use this daily for printing my shipping labels for my business through Paypal. This was one of the best decisions I have made for my business and I only wish I had made the purchase sooner! It was so easy to use. It was so easy to connect. Absolutely no issues whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Mc

customer_reviews.title: Expensive paperweight
customer_reviews.text: Lasted a year, now it just states error or no memory. Tried a dozen times to uninstall and reinstall. Updated driver to no avail. Asked dymo for help, no response. Expensive paperweight. Wasted tons of labels and now a dead machine. And tons of labels left over. Don't want to buy another if it only lasted a year.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Foster

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Print Correctly on Labels
customer_reviews.text: Never worked. Okay, it worked once, then strangely never printed correctly again. Even after the very nice customer service folks at DYMO exhausted all options, it still didn't work using their labels and instructions. After I was issued an RMA, I figured I would give up and move on. I may have had a bad one, but it wasn't worth hours of my life to try and figure it out. On to the next one.
customer_reviews.author: Liberty Maniacs

customer_reviews.title: Good printer so far
customer_reviews.text: Good printer so far. Setup was very easy. First few prints were coming out crooked. Make sure it is all the way to the side. Once I pushed the holding clip on tighter printing was just fine. I have heard that you can only use their labels but have not tried any other labels yet. I will update if I do find that only Dymo labels can be used as that would not be good!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Kotlisky

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK WITH macOS Catalina
customer_reviews.text: DOES NOT WORK WITH macOS Catalina and it has been many many months since Catalina was released and still Demo does not have software that works AVOID THIS COMPANY!
customer_reviews.author: E. Pope

customer_reviews.title: stopped working after 1 month :(
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing for one month. so fast and easy to use. Then after a month, the port connecting it to my computer stopped working. I tried various cables but no luck. Wrote to customer service but no reply. I needed this for a job so I just had to order a whole new one, which was way more expensive than when i originally bought it. really disappointed because i was so happy with the machine at first
customer_reviews.author: kellyanne mifflin

customer_reviews.title: This Dymo Label writer is my new best friend. It is super easy to load (not ...
customer_reviews.text: This Dymo Label writer is my new best friend. It is super easy to load (not always the case with label printers) and works like a charm. I had no problems linking it up to my Macbook and Imac and was printing labels within a manner of mere minutes. We use this brand at my friends business as well and they work beautifully. Print several dozen labels each day with no problems. I wish all printers were as easy to operate as this little guy is.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gadsby

customer_reviews.title: I downloaded it and it now works great. DYMO should be mentioning this STRONGLY on their ...
customer_reviews.text: Received this unit just yesterday, but CD would not install software. I have the latest IMac running Yosemite. Visit to their website did not solve anything UNTIL I found the LATEST software for Mac which is 8.5.2 vs. the 8.3 enclosed with my unit. I downloaded it and it now works great. DYMO should be mentioning this STRONGLY on their website but they do not. Probably some units have been returned because of this. Vic Pierson
customer_reviews.author: V. Pierson

customer_reviews.title: ? Works on MAC OS
customer_reviews.text: Would not work with Mac to print stamps. Worked with windows.. Error message was it cannot be used on my account with Mac OS . I assume that because endicia is running on a window; the DYM software expects to find endicia for Windows on a windows machine .Iow i wanted to print stamps on my Mac Independent of my windows endicia machine. Doable ?
customer_reviews.author: Bones

customer_reviews.title: Great Product + Outstanding Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this product about 8 months ago. I need it for printing barcodes. It has worked perfectly. The barcodes are printed clearly and are easy to scan. I have had to call DYMO a couple of time bc I am technologically challenged! Each time the customer service people (located in the United States, ps) have been extremely professional, patient and helpful. I wold recommend DYMO for their customer service alone. I have stopped doing business with companies who outsource customer service to other countries, with the exception of a few software companies who train their staff very well.
customer_reviews.author: Utopia

customer_reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily to print Amazon FBA labels (a LOT of them) and it is so nice to not have to keep re-filling my ink supply. This printer is AMAZING and runs like a champ! Two thumbs up here!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: bad quality, don't buy
customer_reviews.text: I bought this junk several months ago. It worked fine in the beginning. But later it started to print a lot of things that I didn't expected until yesterday, a paper was clogged into the roll. I tried my best and very carefully to get the paper out of the machine. But one of the roll cracked. I have to throw it to the garbage can.
customer_reviews.author: Jack L

customer_reviews.title: Works great, set up was confusing.
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is easy to use. It took awhile on their website to find the correct software to download. They do not make it very clear on the website. But once I found the correct software it has worked great. Software is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: ShellieG

customer_reviews.title: NEVER BUY FROM THIS COMPANY!!!
customer_reviews.text: 1. The product was used but I wasn't expecting it to be disgustingly dirty when I got it. 2. The product did not work. After contacting Dymo for the work around the software would not load. 3. I contacted the seller and they agreed to return and never did.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Label Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Great printer! The software is easy to use and works great for printing standard name labels. It even integrates with an online program I use. It's so easy to buy refill labels that fit and are cheaper than the Dymo brand. I've purchased three for my work and they've been steady with constant use for the past two years. You can't go wrong with Dymo!
customer_reviews.author: Madi

customer_reviews.title: Great exchange product, you need the power cable though
customer_reviews.text: I was pleased with the product. However, I was surprised that the same came without the power supply and cable. If not because I already had the predecessor to this model, I would have been upset not to receive the cable as it was not notified in any of the writings for the product.
customer_reviews.author: Joskin

customer_reviews.title: JAM JAM AND JAM!!!! Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe this product has such a high review. I don’t review products very often but this one and the 4XL one I feel like I need to write an alert for everybody. Just one word about it: JAM JAM AND JAM!!!! Such a waste of money. I can’t believe it. NEVER BUY THIS ONE!!! Never!!!
customer_reviews.author: Yen Doan

customer_reviews.title: Small Business
customer_reviews.text: We have a small business & use this to print package labels. Works great! Only complaint, it shipped in original box, not a box inside a box. Plus the box wasnt even sealed. Thankfully everything was inside & everything worked!
customer_reviews.author: Rickman.Soup

customer_reviews.title: Great label printer to set up on a small business network
customer_reviews.text: Finally, found a label maker for printing prescription labels that is easy to set up yourself on a small business network and uses affordable labels. I had to purchase the additional dymo print server to do this, but now it works perfectly. Happy with this after switching from difficult to set up zebra printer.
customer_reviews.author: EHMartinez

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Poor product and description of product. Not only did mine not work but in the sales description they fail to tell you that you have to pay a $10.00 monthly price to use the machine. Can’t really tell you how it worked cause mine was broken
customer_reviews.author: Tracy L Cook

customer_reviews.title: Bad Technical Support
customer_reviews.text: We have had trouble getting a label driver for the printer. We have a 2" x 3.5" label that needs to be printed from a windows application - the existing driver for that label wastes a label after printing one. Apparently, there is a custom label that can be made by DYMO (see website) - however, repeated emails and phone calls result in no response from the company. I have left several messages and have been promised that someone would call back - but nothing for 2 weeks now. If you are purchasing make sure that your label is supported - else you are going to be left with a paper weight and no support.
customer_reviews.author: ya0730

customer_reviews.title: We love the label maker and it works for what we ...
customer_reviews.text: We love the label maker and it works for what we need it for. SInce purchase 3 months ago we have gone thorugh about 700 labels. It is easy to use. Our only complaint is that it does freeze once in a while and wastes a label in the "freezing" process.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works really good I sell on Ebay and have used this for ...
customer_reviews.text: Works really good I sell on Ebay and have used this for thousands of bulk shipping labels. However prints really dense in normal setting causing bar-codes to blend together and may cause issues with getting items tracked correctly by USPS scanners. I suggest if you are going to use it for USPS labels reduce the print density to Light makes a big difference
customer_reviews.author: Pierre D Washington

customer_reviews.title: Yes this does work with Linux!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic! Works very well with Linux. I make PDF files in latex with the page size matching the size of the label, and print using LPR. I'm astonished at how well it works! Printing stamps requires proprietary software provided for free that only works on Windows and Mac, so I boot into windows to print out postage whenever I need it on brother stamp labels.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Dufault

customer_reviews.title: I hate this with the fire of a thousand suns
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst thing I have ever bought for my business. I hate it. I wish I could return it. I can’t do now it’s a really sucky ugly paperweight
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Martinez

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Dymo makes great products that makes work or life better. The Dymo 450 works great in an industrial setting and office setting. Easy to use, prints quick, makes professional labels, and no messy ink/toner. Add an external HP Jet direct and you can network the printer. Labels are study and adhere nicely.
customer_reviews.author: SA

customer_reviews.title: the printer o work correctly since early first set up steps!
customer_reviews.text: At first, after turning on the printer, it didn't work properly. means couldn't roll the label out correctly. I had to turn it on/off a couple of times. then I tested the backward bottom but this one does not work at all!! after installing the software it did not print labels but kept running out labels. almost I lost 1 roll of barcode label with this printer. I uninstalled and again installed software but did not work again. the software and all steps were the same as tutorial videoes. I really need a label printer NOW for my work but this one just waste my time!
customer_reviews.author: Su

customer_reviews.title: Their Mac drivers and software were super lame. I spent an hour on the phone ...
customer_reviews.text: I use Macs at home and in my office. I had tried the Brother brand version of this product without success. Their Mac drivers and software were super lame. I spent an hour on the phone with Brother tech support. When they told me to reinstall my OS I figured there was probably a better way. So I bought the Dymo and it works great. It prints reliably every time. The software allows me to cut and paste the address block from an MS Word document right onto an address label. I could never get the Brother product to do that! This product saves me (and my office) time and makes my letters look good.
customer_reviews.author: M. Baum

product_meta.title: DYMO Label Printer | LabelWriter 450 Turbo Direct Thermal Label Printer, Fast Printing, Great for Labeling, Filing, Mailing, Barcodes and More, Home & Office Organization
product_meta.description: Style:Machine| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe LabelWriter 450 Turbo Label Printer not only prints up to 71 four line address labels per minute, but prints postage too. Customize and print address, shipping, file folder, and barcode labels, plus name badges, and more straight from your PC or Mac. Save time and money at the office with the versatile LabelWriter 450 Turbo. Compatible with Windows 7 or later and Mac OS X v10.10 or later. Microsoft and Windows are either registered trademarks or trademarks of Microsoft Corporation in the United States and/or other countries. Mac and OS X are trademarks of Apple Inc., registered in the U.S. and other countries.
feature_bullets: TURBO LABELING AND PRINTING: Create and print up to 71 4 line address, shipping, file folder and barcode labels, name badges, and more per minute
NEVER BUY INK AGAIN: Direct Thermal printing technology eliminates the cost of ink and toner
EASILY CUSTOMIZE AND PRINT LABELS: Create labels directly from text in Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, and Google Contacts
USE WITH AUTHENTIC DYMO LABELS: For best performance, use DYMO Label Writer Labels in a variety of sizes
The maximum width of labels for LW450 unit is 2.2 inches
ELIMINATE THE WASTE AND HASSLE OF SHEET LABELS: The DYMO Label Writer 450 Turbo prints precise quantities without difficulty

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,888 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Currently, item can be shipped only within the U.S. and to APO/FPO addresses. For APO/FPO shipments, please check with the manufacturer regarding warranty and support issues.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
